name: lib/cache/cacheBase.js
CacheBase
description:
Our base Cache implementation
Extend this class with new implementations to create different cache types (in-memory, database, file system etc.)

params.name: options.useMemoryCache
params.description:
Use an in-memory layer on top of this cache
 Avoid hitting databases too often
 Not useful if using any distributed setup where memory will be out-of-sync between processes

params.name: options.memoryCacheTimeout
params.description:
Timeout for in-memory cache values
 Default is null, which will use the incoming ttl values for each key

name: _get
description: Internal implementation of Get()

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

return.description: Returns the object in the cache, or undefined if not present

name: _set
description: Internal implementation of Set()

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: ttl
params.description: How long the cache entry should last in milliseconds

name: get
description: Get a cached object

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

return.description: Returns the object in the cache, or undefined if not present

name: set
description: Set a key in our cache

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: ttl
params.description:
How long the cache entry should last in milliseconds
 Can be a number or a function that will return a number
 Default 1 hour

name: wrap
description:
A helper "wrap" function that will return a cached value if present
 This will call the supplied function to fetch it if the value isn't present in the cache

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: fn
params.description: Fetch function that will be called if the cache entry is not present

params.name: ttl
params.description:
How long the cache entry should last in milliseconds
 Can be a number or a function that will return a number

createCacheInstance

Create a new Cache Instance.
This function should only be called once for the lifetime of the module.

description: Get the configured Cache implementation

name: lib/configBase.js
ConfigBase
description:
Base Config Object
Supports classes with a single argument "options"
These will be sorted into a member called "this.config" containing all the same keys

Crucially, these can also be overriden through environment variables
For example, for a config option "timeout" for class Database, this could be overriden through either:
  env.THEMEPARKS_TIMEOUT (using a "global module name")
  env.DATABASE_TIMEOUT (using the class name)

Classes can also add additional prefixes to the supported environment variables through:
  new ClassInstance({configPrefixes: ['myCustomPrefix']});
Which would also allow env.MYCUSTOMPREFIX_TIMEOUT to be used

Note that a default value must be supplied for the environment variable to be processed
If the default value is a number, the environment variable will be cast to a number as well

name: constructor
description: A base class that can be configured through environment variables

name: lib/parks/park.js

types: {"QUEUE_STANDBY": string, "QUEUE_SINGLERIDER": string, "QUEUE_VIRTUALQUEUE": string, "QUEUE_FASTPASS": string, "ATTRACTION_RIDE": string, "ATTRACTION_SHOW": string, "ATTRACTION_TRANSPORT": string, "ATTRACTION_PARADE": string, "ATTRACTION_MEET_AND_GREET": string, "STATUS_OPERATING": string, "STATUS_DOWN": string, "STATUS_CLOSED": string, "STATUS_REFURBISHMENT": string}

name: Park
description: Base Park Object

name: constructor
description: Create a new park object

name: getParkUniqueID
description: Get a globally unique ID for this park

name: getAttractions
description: Get Park Attractions

name: init
description:
Setup the park for use
Call to ensure the object has been initialised before accessing data

name: _runInit
description: Run all the internal stages of the init process

name: _buildAttractionObject
description:
Build an object representing an attraction from sourced data
This object should not contain any "state" data, just static information about the attraction

name: findAttractionByID
description: Get data about a attraction from its ID

name: _updateAttractionState
description: Update an attraction state

name: update
description:
Update this park
This is automatically called for you unless disableParkUpdate is set to false

name: _init
description:
Internal function
Called by init() to initialise the object

name: _update
description: Update function the park object calls on interval to update internal state

name: injectForDomain
description: Register a new injection for a specific domain

params.name: domain
params.description: Domain to inject for, accepts wildcards. See domain-match

params.name: func
params.description: Function to call with needle request to inject extra data into. Must return a Promise

name: http
description:
Helper function to make an HTTP request for this park
Parks can automatically add in authentication headers etc. to requests sent to this function

params.name: data
params.description: data to send. Will become querystring for GET, body for POST

name: lib/parks/wdw/waltdisneyworldbase.js
getDatabase
description: Get the live WDW database object

name: DisneyPark
description: Base Disney Park Class

name: constructor
description: Create a new DisneyPark object

name: getParkUniqueID
description: Get a unique ID for this park

name: getFacilityStatusChannelID
description: Get the channel ID for the facility status live update documents

name: _processAttractionStatusUpdate
description: Process a document update from a facilitystatus channel

name: _buildAttractionObject
description: Build an attraction object from an ID

name: lib/parks/wdw/wdwdb.js
getEntityID
description: Return the entity ID of an object

return.description: Entity ID, or undefined if unavailable

name: WDWPouchDB
description: Custom implementation of PouchDB for our WDW database sync

name: constructor
description: Build our WDWPouchDB object (passes straight through to PouchDB())

name: DisneyDB
description:
Live Database object for Disney parks using couchbase databases
Will syncronise databae locally before accessing, allowing fast queries

name: constructor
description: Create a new DisneyDB object

name: init
description: Initialise the live database, returns once finished an initial sync

name: _loadAndInit
description:
Internal function
Loads and performs an initial sync on the database

name: getDumpFilename
description:
Get the filename we use for saving backups of the database to disk
Used for creating simple "snapshots" to reduce initial sync times

name: load
description:
Restore a database backup from disk
Perform this after running "dump()" on a previous synced database
This will help to reduce the initial sync time for large databases

name: dump
description:
Dump this live database to disk
This will be used to "seed" the database to speed up syncs for future runs

name: _scheduleDBDump
description:
Begin a database dump loop
This will dump the database to disk every 15 minutes (override with options.checkpointTime)
 to speed up initial syncs

name: get
description:
Get a document from this live database
Will wait until database is syncronised before returning
See PouchDB.get(...) for options

name: getDocsById
description: Get an array of documents from an array of _id

name: findIndexEntity
description: Find search index entries by ID

name: findEntity
description: Search for an entity in the WDW database

name: findOne
description:
Search for an entity in the WDW database
Attempts to return the "best candidate" single document that matches the incoming ID

name: findFacilityStatus
description: Get the live facility status for a given entity ID

name: findByChannel
description:
Find all documents by channel
eg. 'wdw.facilitystatus.1_0' to get all WDW facility status documents

name: find
description: Return all documents in the database that match the given filter

name: subscribeToChanges
description: Subscribe to all database changes with an optional mongo-style filter

name: subscribeToChannel
description: Subscribe to all changes to a channel

content:
# Parks API

![Unit Test](https://github.com/ThemeParks/parksapi/workflows/Unit%20Test/badge.svg) ![Documentation Build](https://github.com/ThemeParks/parksapi/workflows/ESDoc/badge.svg)

[API Documentation](https://themeparks.github.io/parksapi/)

This is a backend module to fetch and query live data for themeparks.

Template support is provided in this module. Most parks require some form of credentials, which are not supplied in this repo.
name: ./README.md
